official_title: To amend titles 5 and 10, United States Code, to provide that any child who is ineligible for survivor annuity, life insurance, or health benefits coverage under such titles because of being married may qualify for such coverage if that marriage is terminated by reason of death, annulment, or divorce.
short_title: Unmarried Child Benefits Correction Act of 1991

summary.text: Unmarried Child Benefits Correction Act of 1991 - Title I: Children of Civil Service Employees - Defines "unmarried child" to include one whose marriage has been dissolved by death, divorce, or annulment within one year of the date of the marriage for purposes of civil service survivor annuities, life insurance, and health benefits. Title II: Children of Members of the Armed Forces - Provides the same definition of an unmarried child for purposes of military medical and dental care and survivor annuities.

titles.title: Unmarried Child Benefits Correction Act of 1991

To amend titles 5 and 10, United States Code, to provide that any child who is ineligible for survivor annuity, life insurance, or health benefits coverage under such titles because of being married may qualify for such coverage if that marriage is terminated by reason of death, annulment, or divorce.
